column1: #Text=The polycrystalline sample of Mn1.4Pt0.9Pd0.1Sn was prepared by first arc-melting in a high-purity argon atmosphere stoichiometric amounts of the constituent elements to form an ingot.
#Text=The as-prepared ingots were annealed for 1 week at 1073 K and subsequently quenched in an ice-water mixture to obtain the final material.

#Text=For the transmission electron microscopy (TEM) investigation, we have prepared a wedge-shaped lamella by means of a Ga focused ion-beam (FIB) milling apparatus [FEI Nova Nanolab 600 SEM/FIB operating at 30 keV ion-beam energy].
#Text=The thickness of the lamella was determined by electron energy loss spectroscopy (EELS)23.

#Text=For this purpose we have determined the local thickness, t, from the relationship, t = λ ln (It/I0), where λ is the total inelastic mean free path of electrons, It and I0 are the total and zero-loss intensities in the EELS spectrum, respectively.
#Text=The sample has a thickness that varies from ~90 to ~250 nm.

#Text=TEM investigations were carried out with an aberration-corrected, high-resolution transmission electron microscope [FEI TITAN 80-300] operated at an acceleration voltage of 300 keV using a GATAN double-tilt sample holder allowing for variable temperatures between 100 and 365 K.
#Text=For the investigation of anti-skyrmions, TEM experiments were performed in the conventional Lorentz TEM (LTEM) mode.
#Text=An in situ vertical magnetic field was applied to the wedge-shaped lamella by applying currents in the objective lens.
#Text=Thereby, in-plane magnetic fields were realized by tilting the sample using a double-tilt sample holder (maximum tilting up to ~± 30°).
